meanings.definition: To remove or extract roots from the ground.
meanings.sent1: She was unrooting the weeds from the garden.
meanings.sent2: The farmer unrooted the old tree to make space for new plants.
meanings.sent3: The determined gardener was unrooting the stubborn roots with a smile.
meanings.sent4: The storm unrooted the trees, leaving a path of destruction.
meanings.sent5: The act of unrooting the invasive plants was back-breaking but satisfying.

meanings.sent1: The team was unrooting the invasive species from the ecosystem.
meanings.sent2: The detective was unrooting the corruption from the city government.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's power was unrooting evil from the world.
meanings.sent4: Her determination unrooted all doubts from her mind.
meanings.sent5: The potion had the power of unrooting any illness from the body.

meanings.definition: To dislodge or remove from a fixed position.
meanings.sent1: The strong wind was unrooting the tent pegs.
meanings.sent2: The construction crew was unrooting the old foundation to build a new structure.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was unrooting the bird feeder for snacks.
meanings.sent4: His words unrooted her from her comfort zone.
meanings.sent5: The earthquake unrooted the boulder that had been in place for centuries.
